metadata.title: YouTube Studio Setup Guide 2025: Build Your Recording Space
metadata.description: Build the perfect YouTube recording studio. Space, lighting, and acoustic tips.

hero.headline: YouTube Studio Setup Guide
hero.subheadline: Build your space. Create professional content at home.

sections.content: A dedicated recording space transforms your content quality and workflow. Whether a corner of a room or an entire studio, thoughtful setup eliminates production friction. Good lighting, sound treatment, and organization let you focus on content, not troubleshooting. Here's how to build your studio.

sections.title: Studio Setup Tips
content: Sound treatment often more important than camera
Consider camera angle in room layout
Test before committing to permanent setup
Leave room to grow and add gear

faq.question: How much space do I need?
faq.answer: 6x6 feet minimum for talking head. Larger for product reviews or movement. Ceiling height matters for lighting. Work with what you have—great content made in closets. Optimize your space.

faq.question: What to prioritize first?
faq.answer: Audio treatment often more impactful than camera upgrade. Then lighting. Camera last—decent cameras with good light and sound outperform great cameras with bad audio. Budget accordingly.

faq.question: How to soundproof on a budget?
faq.answer: Moving blankets are cheap absorption. Carpets and curtains help. Record during quiet times. Closets with clothes = free sound treatment. Foam panels later. Perfect isn't required.

faq.question: DIY or buy studio furniture?
faq.answer: Both work—IKEA desks popular for budget setups. Custom builds fit exactly. Start with what you have, upgrade as you understand needs. Permanent installations after you know what works.
